page.title: 01 MARDEN QUARRY.
page.content: The Quarry started in 1684 when it was leased for quarrying of limestone.It was abandoned in the 19th century and gradually filled up with water.It was used as a stand by reservoir until 1975.It was decided to change the area into a park.North Tyneside Council partly filled the lake to make it shallow and created little islands and reed beds to attract nesting sites for waders and ducks.The rest of the park was left in its natural state. The mixture of grassland,hawthorn scrub woodland attract a wide variety of birds such as Wigeon,Teal and also Willow Warbler,Treecreeper, Pied Flycatcher,Spotted Flycatcher. Bird watchers have already sighted rarer species such as Bluethroat,Red- Backed Shrike,Wryneck and Ring Ouzel.
